channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-4787] Track tasks needed to release Derby 10.6.2
item.summary: Track tasks needed to release Derby 10.6.2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The Documentation tab, 10.6 manual and 10.5 manual did not link to the right Derby Server and Administration Guide HTML page link. Change xdocs/index.html and attach a patch.

Lily, if you do an svn diff after your build, does the html file under the build directory show as checked out too? I think for some reason for the website that generated file has to be checked in too.

Hi Kathey:
Yes, it does generate that as well. I am replacing the earlier patch to include that as well. For some space reason, it also diff on two other different language for getstart manual. Hope those are okay to check-in too.

It is not okay with getstart Japanese characters diff. After 'forrest site', the build process creates getstart manual title with garble information. Manually change the build/site/manuals/index.xml to reflect the necessary change. I use xml editor to look at the source file at src/documentation/content/xdocs/manuals/index.xml. The Japanese characters are fine there.

Thanks Lily, the patch looks good to me now. I don't know how to get around the Windows Japanese issue except as you have.

http://old.nabble.com/Encoding-problem-for-the-Japanese-characters-on-the-documentation-page-ts23365368.html#a23365368
This is the draft for 10.6.2.0 release note. Please review and let me know if you see any issue or more fixes will be added by 9/14/2010 when I make the release candidate.
DERBY-2925 also needs release note. Attach a new version of RELEASE_NOTES to include that.

Hi Lily,

The release notes look good to me. A couple minor issues I noticed:

  • Under "New Features" it says "This release addresss a data corruption issue." Should fix typo: addresss -> addresses
  • Build Environment says "Machine - Git on Microsoft Windows 7". What's Git?
  • Build Environment says phoneME was used to build JSR-169 support. I got the impression from the discussion on derby-dev that you did not use phoneME, so perhaps just remove that line?

Hi Knut:
Thank you so much for reviewing the release note.

The following changes is reflected to the new version of RELEASE-NOTES.html:
1. typo: change to "This release addresses a data corruption issue."
2. Git is msysgit. The office link is http://en.kioskea.net/faq/499-git-for-windows. It behaves just like cygwin.
3. JSR is removed.

Please keep reviewing them as I have a lot to learn about all the details for 10.6.2.0.

Hi Lily,

The draft release notes look good. A couple comments:

o I would slightly reword the first sentence under New Features: "This is a bug fix release which also provides localizations of new 10.6 messages."

o The description for DERBY-2925 conveys no useful information.

o In the detailed release note for DERBY-4677, the reference to 10.4.x.x should be changed to 10.4.2.1.

Thanks,
-Rick

Hi Rick:
Thank you so much for the quick review for the draft release notes.

1. New Features is now ""This is a bug fix release which also provides localizations of new 10.6 messages."

2. I need to figure out whether this is fixable in our process. The description for DERBY-2925 was not having useful information due to having parent issue tag. I am currently manually changing the fixedBugsList.html --> fixedBugsList.xml so we grep the right description for DERBY-2925

3. Hope it is okay with everybody. I change the releaseNote.html for DERBY-4677 to reference 10.4.2.1 from 10.4.x.x. Then, I have to manually change the id for ReportParser.java to grep the right releaseNote.html for the RELEASE-NOTES.html.

Please keep reviewing the changes and the new version of RELEASE-NOTES.html. I am still very new to release process.

Hi Lily, I think maybe the filter is not picking up closed issues, e.g. DERBY-4717.

Also the JSR169 line should come out of the ReleaseNotesGenerator.java program to avoid it printing on the release notes.

If we are to stick with the html format then it would be nice if we could parse out the parent tags and also read fixedBugsList.html instead of xml as it would be less confusing. If we have to keep the hard coding of the bugs and attachment id's, Comments in the program said we changed to html because of the changing xml format, but I a am surprised that the html is not even more volatile and fragile.

There should be 37 issue id on Bug fixes table. The filter I built earlier did not include closed issue. Upload new draft of RELEASE-NOTES.html. Please review it and let me know if there is any issue. Thanks!!!

Hi Kathey:
Sorry, I did not read your comment before I send the RELEASE-NOTES.html I created yesterday. Thank you so much for helping me to get to this far on the release process. I couldn't do it without you.

The JSR section is not in the RELEASE-NOTES.html after Knut's comment and they had been removed from the source code.

As far as changing back to use .xml format, I am not sure how to change the ReleaseNoteGenerator.java back to use .xml format. I will take a look at the 10.5 branch code. At this point, I think it is more constructive for me to focus on how to improve the release process. However, I am not trying to say either .html or .xml format is better. I am focus on how to improve the current generating a release process.

Overall, I was able to create the RELEASE-NOTES.html in a timely fashion. However, there are two steps which I would suggest to spend more time to improve.

1. Manual process to extract description if the JIRA issue has parent id.
How to solve it so it is more programmatic?

Right now,
The tag looks like this if JIRA issue has parent id:
<a href="http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DE
RBY-2925"> <img src="fixedBugsList1_files/issue_subtask.gif" alt="Sub-task" titl
e="Sub-task - The sub-task of the issue" width="16" align="absmiddle" border="0"
height="16"></a>
</td>
<td class="nav issuekey">

<a href="http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-2925">DERBY-2925</a>

</td>
<td class="nav summary">
<a href="http://issues.apach
e.org/jira/browse/DERBY-2437" class="parentIssue" title="SYSCS_EXPORT_TABLE can
be used to overwrite derby files">DERBY-2437</a><br>
<img src="fixedBugsList1_files/link_out_bot.gif" alt
="" width="16" align="absmiddle" border="0" height="16">
<a href="http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-2925
" style="text-decoration: none;">Prevent export from overwriting existing files<
/a>

Change to:

<a href="http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DE
RBY-2925"> <img src="http://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/issue_subtask.gi
f" height="16" width="16" border="0" align="absmiddle" alt="Sub-task" title="Sub
-task - The sub-task of the issue"></a>
</td>
<td class="nav issuekey">

<a href="http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-2925">DERBY-2925</a>

</td>
<td class="nav summary">
<a href="http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-2925
" style="text-decoration: none; ">Prevent export from overwriting existing files
</a>

so ParseKey() will extract the right description for JIRA like this when running genrelnotes target in tools/release directory.

This is the ParseKey method in RelaseNoteGenerator.java on 10.6 branch:
public String parseKey( TagReader tr ) throws Exception

{ tr.reset(); tr.position( "issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-", true ); String keyString = tr.getUpTill( "\">", true ); return keyString; }

The pattern is fine with JIRA issue that does not have extra tag info to extract the key as description. I cannot see a better pattern to extract the key than the one we already have. Any suggestion on how to improve it is welcome. Rick suggest people have some ideas about this?

2. I am regenerating a new .xml format and grep for releaseNote.html to find out the JIRA that require release note for Issues are in the release note.

For the current data I have for 10.6.2.0, I got the following from the .xml file:
$ grep releaseNote.html fixedBugsListxml.xml
<attachment id="12454149" name="releaseNote.html" size="3891" author
="lilywei" created="Wed, 8 Sep 2010 16:11:35 -0400 (EDT)" />
<attachment id="12447876" name="releaseNote.html" size="3891" author
="mamtas" created="Wed, 23 Jun 2010 16:17:43 -0400 (EDT)" />
<attachment id="12447606" name="releaseNote.html" size="3979" author
="mamtas" created="Mon, 21 Jun 2010 12:38:06 -0400 (EDT)" />
<attachment id="12447055" name="releaseNote.html" size="4018" author
="mamtas" created="Mon, 14 Jun 2010 15:10:16 -0400 (EDT)" />
<comment id="12584134" author="rhillegas" created="Tue, 1 Ap
r 2008 09:33:30 -0400 (EDT)" >Re-attaching release note as releaseNote.html sin
ce this is the file name which the release notes generator looks for.</comment>
<attachment id="12379029" name="releaseNote.html" size="4770" author
="rhillegas" created="Tue, 1 Apr 2008 09:33:30 -0400 (EDT)" />

From there, I confirm the result id and put it into my getReleaseNoteAttachmentID method in ReportParse.java.

Luckily, there are only two JIRA issue that need release note information on 10.6.2.0

I also think we can have more programmatic way to gather release note information on issue. Any suggestion is welcome. Thanks!

This is the changes I make to make the 10.6.2.0 release note. Please review it.
If there is any issue, please let me know if you see any issue or more fixes will be added by 9/14/2010.

Thanks Lily the diff looks good. I would say check this all in at 5pm Monday San Francisco time and close the branch at that time in preparation for the Tuesday release candidate. That way you should be able to look at the nightlies Tuesday morning and make sure everything is ready.
Release 10.6.2.1 is released.
[bulk update] Close all resolved issues that haven't been updated for more than one year.

Attaching derby-4787-01-aa-updateMessageSummary.diff. This updates the Reference Guide section titled "SQL error messages and exceptions" to make it reflect message changes made since we built 10.6.2.1.

Touches the following file:

M src/ref/rrefexcept71493.dita

Commit 1557729 from Rick Hillegas in branch 'docs/branches/10.6'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1557729 ]

DERBY-4787: Bring documented message summary into agreement with the current state of the 10.6 code; commit derby-4787-01-aa-updateMessageSummary.diff.

Attaching derby-4787-02-aa-updateCopyrightYear.diff, which adjusts the copyright year in the 10.6 docs. Touches the following files:

M src/tools/rtoolscopyright.dita
M src/ja_JP/ref/rrefcopyright.dita
M src/ja_JP/getstart/rgscopyright.dita
M src/tuning/rtuncopyright.dita
M src/adminguide/radmincopyright.dita
M src/pt_BR/adminguide/radmincopyright.dita
M src/pt_BR/ref/rrefcopyright.dita
M src/pt_BR/getstart/rgscopyright.dita
M src/devguide/rdevcopyright.dita
M src/ref/rrefcopyright.dita
M src/getstart/rgscopyright.dita

Commit 1557745 from Rick Hillegas in branch 'docs/branches/10.6'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1557745 ]

DERBY-4787: Advance the copyright year in the 10.6 docs to 2014; commit derby-4787-02-aa-updateCopyrightYear.diff.
Attaching derby-4787-03-aa-updateCopyrightYearInDitamaps.diff. This patch updates the copyright year in the doc ditamaps.

Commit 1557757 from Rick Hillegas in branch 'docs/branches/10.6'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1557757 ]

DERBY-4787: Adjust the copyright year in the doc ditamaps; commit derby-4787-03-aa-updateCopyrightYearInDitamaps.diff.

Commit 1557772 from Rick Hillegas in branch 'code/branches/10.6'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1557772 ]

DERBY-4787: Bump the head of the 10.6 branch to 10.6.2.4.
